files.patch:
@@ -55,3 +55,7 @@ -
  • FileChooser shows up a virtual directory and file with name -

    Swing Rocks!. -
  • On "HTML disabled" frame : +
  • JFileChooser shows a virtual directory. + The first file in the list has the following name: + <html><h1 color=#ff00ff><font + face="Serif">Swing Rocks! +
    +
    +
  • In HTML disabled frame: @@ -59,5 +63,7 @@ -
  • Verify that the folder and file name must be plain text. -
  • If the name in file pane window and also in directory - ComboBox remains in plain text, then press Pass. - If it appears to be in HTML format with Pink color as - shown, then press Fail. +
  • Verify that the first file name displays + as plain text, + that is you see the HTML tags in the file name. +
  • If the file name in the file pane and + in the navigation combo box above is displayed + as HTML, that is in large font and magenta color, + then press Fail. @@ -66,1 +72,1 @@ -
  • On "HTML enabled" frame : +
  • In HTML enabled frame: @@ -68,5 +74,8 @@ -
  • Verify that the folder and file name remains in HTML - format with name "Swing Rocks!" pink in color as shown. -
  • If the name in file pane window and also in directory - ComboBox remains in HTML format string, then press Pass. - If it appears to be in plain text, then press Fail. +
  • Verify that the first file name displays as HTML, + that is Swing Rocks! in large font + and magenta color. +
  • If the file name in the file pane and + in the navigation combo box above is displayed + as HTML, then press Pass.
    + If it is in plain text, then press Fail. @@ -102,0 +111,1 @@ + .rows(20) @@ -113,1 +123,1 @@ - private static JFrame createFileChooser(boolean htmlEnabled) { + private static JFrame createFileChooser(boolean htmlDisabled) { @@ -115,1 +125,1 @@ - jfc.putClientProperty("html.disable", htmlEnabled); + jfc.putClientProperty("html.disable", htmlDisabled); @@ -118,1 +128,1 @@ - JFrame frame = new JFrame((htmlEnabled) ? "HTML enabled" : "HTML disabled"); + JFrame frame = new JFrame(htmlDisabled ? "HTML disabled" : "HTML enabled"); @@ -125,0 +135,7 @@ + private final File[] files = { + new File("/", "
